pullRequest.body:
Major new results:

- `*.LinearDisjoint.map`: linear disjointness is preserved by injective ring homomorphism.
- `rank_sup_of_isAlgebraic` -> `rank_sup` at the expense of importing `AlgebraicIndependent`.
- `IntermediateField.LinearDisjoint.algEquiv_of_isAlgebraic`:
  linear disjointness is preserved by isomorphisms, provided that one of the field is algebraic.

Regarding <https://mathoverflow.net/questions/8324>:

- `Subalgebra.LinearDisjoint.isDomain_of_injective`, `Subalgebra.LinearDisjoint.exists_field_of_isDomain_of_injective`:
  `IntermediateField.LinearDisjoint.isDomain'`, `IntermediateField.LinearDisjoint.exists_field_of_isDomain`:
  under some flatness and injectivity conditions, if `A` and `B` are `R`-algebras (resp. fields), then `A âŠ—[R] B` is a domain if and 
  only if there exists a field such that `A` and `B` inject into it and their images are linearly disjoint.
- `IntermediateField.LinearDisjoint.isField_of_forall`, `IntermediateField.LinearDisjoint.of_isField'`:
  if `A` and `B` are field extensions `F`, then `A âŠ—[F] B` is a field if and only if for any field such that `A` and `B` map to it,
  their images are linearly disjoint.
- `Algebra.TensorProduct.not_isField_of_transcendental`,
  `Algebra.TensorProduct.isAlgebraic_of_isField`:
  if `A` and `B` are flat `R`-algebras, both of them are transcendental, then `A âŠ—[R] B` cannot
  be a field, equivalently, if `A âŠ—[R] B` is a field, then one of them is algebraic.
- `Algebra.TensorProduct.isField_of_isAlgebraic`:
  if `E` and `K` are field extensions of `F`, one of them is algebraic, such that
  `E âŠ—[F] K` is a domain, then `E âŠ—[F] K` is also a field.

---

### PR summary [eea1556233](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19614/commits/eea15562332b18180a9a4b5d0dbca1f26636e145)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.FieldTheory.LinearDisjoint | 1763 | 1795 | +32 (+1.82%) |
| Mathlib.RingTheory.LinearDisjoint | 1637 | 1658 | +21 (+1.28%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.LinearDisjoint`|21|
| `Mathlib.FieldTheory.LinearDisjoint`|32|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ LinearDisjoint.symm'`
`+ _root_.Algebra.TensorProduct.isAlgebraic_of_isField`
`+ _root_.Algebra.TensorProduct.isField_of_isAlgebraic`
`+ _root_.Algebra.TensorProduct.not_isField_of_transcendental`
`+ algEquiv_of_isAlgebraic`
`+ exists_field_of_isDomain`
`+ exists_field_of_isDomain_of_injective`
`+ include_range_of_injective`
`+ isDomain'`
`+ isDomain_of_injective`
`+ isField_of_forall`
`+ isField_of_isAlgebraic`
`+ isField_of_isAlgebraic'`
`+ linearDisjoint_comm'`
`+ linearDisjoint_iff_injective`
`+ map'`
`+ map''`
`+ rank_sup`
`++ LinearDisjoint.of_subsingleton_top`
`++ isDomain`
`++ mulMap_map_comp_eq`
`++ of_isField`
`++ of_isField'`
`+++ map`
`- rank_sup_of_isAlgebraic`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#19641~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#19745~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#19768~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#19670~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#19832~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#19933~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Thanks!

```suggestion
/-- Linear disjointness is preserved by injective algebra homomorphisms. -/
```

```suggestion
  linear disjointness is preserved by injective algebra homomorphisms.
```

```suggestion
/-- Linear disjointness is preserved by injective algebra homomorphisms. -/
```

```suggestion
  H.injective.isDomain (A.mulMap B).toRingHom
```

```suggestion
theorem isDomain_of_injective [IsDomain S] {A B : Type*} [Semiring A] [Semiring B]
```
also R and S can be CommSemirings in this one. Whenever flatness is mentioned, though, we must assume Ring. I'm generalizing flatness in #19115, but the current definition is apparently not strong enough for semirings, so I'll need to change the definition ...
But `Function.Injective.isDomain` requires `Ring`...
~~OK generalized to `Semiring` in PR #19774. Comments welcome.~~

Where should this go? It uses `Module.Flat` and `Module.Free.of_divisionRing`. `#find_home` suggests `[Mathlib.RingTheory.LocalRing.Module, Mathlib.RingTheory.LinearDisjoint, Mathlib.Algebra.Category.Ring.LinearAlgebra, Mathlib.RingTheory.Regular.RegularSequence, Mathlib.RingTheory.Unramified.Finite]` (which includes this file), but none of them seems optimal. What about creating a new file `Mathlib.RingTheory.TensorProduct.Nontrivial`?
I guess this is resolved by [this comment](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19832/files#r1875972697) :)
Yes but `nontrivial_of_algebraMap_injective_of_isDomain` should go that file anyway.

```suggestion
  `IntermediateField.LinearDisjoint.exists_field_of_isDomain`:
  if `A` and `B` are field extensions of `F`, then `A âŠ—[F] B`
  is a domain if and only if there exists a field extension of `F` that `A` and `B`
  embed into with linearly disjoint images.
```

```suggestion
  if `A` and `B` are field extensions of `F`, then `A âŠ—[F] B`
  is a field if and only if for any extension of `F` that `A` and `B` embed into, their
  images are linearly disjoint.
```

Sounds better:
```suggestion
- `Algebra.TensorProduct.isField_of_isAlgebraic`:
  if `E` and `K` are field extensions of `F`, one of them is algebraic, and
  `E âŠ—[F] K` is a domain, then `E âŠ—[F] K` is also a field.
```
or
```suggestion
- `Algebra.TensorProduct.isField_of_isAlgebraic`:
  if `E` and `K` are field extensions of `F`, one of them is algebraic, then
  `E âŠ—[F] K` is a domain iff it is a field.
```

```suggestion
  if `A` and `B` are field extensions of `F`, one of them is algebraic, such that they are linearly
  disjoint (more generally, if there exists an extension that they embed into with linearly
  disjoint images), then `A âŠ—[F] B` is a field.
```

```suggestion
/-- Linear disjointness is preserved by algebra homomorphisms. -/
```
would be more appropriate. (same below)
Please change the docstrings here and below the same way as the module docstrings.

[The comment there](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/808600f8f099dc32f03fd226140ffcbddbddf71b/Mathlib/RingTheory/MvPolynomial/Basic.lean#L189) says it's to avoid import loop; but now it's reasonable to import `Basis` (Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Basis.Defs) into Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.AlgebraMap (where [Polynomial.toFinsuppIsoAlg](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Polynomial/AlgebraMap.html#Polynomial.toFinsuppIsoAlg) is defined), it only adds 2 trans imports.
Let me try in another PR.
I think this is true even for `Semiring`...
#19933, waiting for shake results
I'd say "... exists an `R`-algebra that is a field ..."; I guess the reader will understand that we're considering R-AlgHoms.
`R`-algebra `S`

Maybe you could use more descriptive naming for these three lemmas?
```suggestion
/-- Linear disjointness of intermediate fields is preserved by algebra homomorphisms. -/
```
I couldn't think of a better name. If `map''` is removed, do you think the names `map` and `map'` are OK?

```suggestion
/-- Linear disjointness of an intermediate field with a tower of field embeddings is preserved by algebra homomorphisms. -/
```

This is a long statement; is it useful?
Have you thought about the possibility of centering the theory around `LinearMap/AlgHom.LinearDisjoint` instead of `Submodule/Subalgebra.LinearDisjoint`? The LinearMap/AlgHom doesn't have to be injective and you'll still be able to use dot notations.

> This is a long statement; is it useful?

That's a good question. I'm afraid that I overengineered these three versions of `map`; what do you think? Since `IntermediateField.LinearDisjoint` is only for an intermediate field and an abstract field, so maybe `map` and `map'` is enough. (`Subalgebra` version is only for two subalgebras, so there is only a `map`.) For "maybe it's useful" reason, I added `map''`.

> Have you thought about the possibility of centering the theory around `LinearMap/AlgHom.LinearDisjoint` instead of `Submodule/Subalgebra.LinearDisjoint`? The LinearMap/AlgHom doesn't have to be injective and you'll still be able to use dot notations.

I think maybe it's not feasible; the only place using `AlgHom` is the `map` lemma. Moreover, we have `Subalgebra` and `IntermediateField` version of `LinearDisjoint`, if put them to `AlgHom` namespace then we need two separate names.

```suggestion
/-- If `A` and `L` are linearly disjoint over `F`, then `A âŠ—[F] L` is a domain. -/
```

```suggestion
`A` and `B` embed into with linearly disjoint images, then `A âŠ—[F] B` is a domain. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- If `A âŠ—[F] L` is a field, then `A` and `L` are linearly disjoint over `F`. -/
```
Do you want to make this a docstring? Is it useful as a comment?
This is to notify future maintainers that this result can't move to earlier files. But maybe it can if another proof is used.

```suggestion
/-- If `A` and `L` are linearly disjoint and one of them is algebraic,
then `A âŠ—[F] L` is a field. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- If `A` and `B` are field extensions of `F`, one of them is algebraic, such that there exists a
field `E` that `A` and `B` embeds into with linearly disjoint images, then `A âŠ—[F] B`
is a field. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- If `A` and `B` are `R`-algebras, such that there exists a domain `S` over `R`
such that `A` and `B` inject into it and their images are linearly disjoint,
then `A âŠ—[R] B` is also a domain. -/
```
The `AlgHom.LinearDisjoint` version of this would hold without any flatness or injectivity conditions :)

Could you give some details? If `R` is not a field, then these two maps are not necessarily injective, and these two modules are not necessarily flat. Without these conditions I don't know how to prove the result.

```suggestion
/-- If `A` and `B` are flat algebras over `R`, such that `A âŠ—[R] B` is a domain, and such that
the algebra maps are injective, then there exists an `R`-algebra `K` that is a field that `A` 
and `B` inject into with linearly disjoint images. Note: `K` can chosen to be the
fraction field of `A âŠ—[R] B`, but here we hide this fact. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- If `A âŠ—[R] B` is a field, then for any `R`-algebra
`S` and injections of `A` and `B` into `S`, their images are linearly disjoint. -/
```

pullRequest.title: feat: some more properties of linearly disjoint
